about.summary: A tool for Hierarchical Climate Regionalization applicable to any correlation-based clustering. It adds several features and a new clustering method (called, 'regional' linkage) to hierarchical clustering in R ('hclust' function in 'stats' library): data regridding, coarsening spatial resolution, geographic masking, contiguity-constrained clustering, data filtering by mean and/or variance thresholds, data preprocessing (detrending, standardization, and PCA), faster correlation function with preliminary big data support, different clustering methods, hybrid hierarchical clustering, multivariate clustering (MVC), cluster validation, visualization of regionalization results, and exporting region map and mean timeseries into NetCDF-4 file.

A tool for Hierarchical Climate Regionalization applicable to any correlation-based clustering. It adds several features and a new clustering method (called, 'regional' linkage) to hierarchical clustering in R ('hclust' function in 'stats' library): data regridding, coarsening spatial resolution, geographic masking, contiguity-constrained clustering, data filtering by mean and/or variance thresholds, data preprocessing (detrending, standardization, and PCA), faster correlation function with preliminary big data support, different clustering methods, hybrid hierarchical clustering, multivariate clustering (MVC), cluster validation, visualization of regionalization results, and exporting region map and mean timeseries into NetCDF-4 file.

name: r-hiclimr

about.summary: A tool for Hierarchical Climate Regionalization applicable to any correlation-based clustering. It adds several features and a new clustering method (called, 'regional' linkage) to hierarchical clustering in R ('hclust' function in 'stats' library): data regridding, coarsening spatial resolution, geographic masking, contiguity-constrained clustering, data filtering by mean and/or variance thresholds, data preprocessing (detrending, standardization, and PCA), faster correlation function with preliminary big data support, different clustering methods, hybrid hierarchical clustering, multivariate clustering (MVC), cluster validation, visualization of regionalization results, and exporting region map and mean timeseries into NetCDF-4 file.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.2.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-hiclimr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/HiClimR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/HiClimR/HiClimR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: c85a8036a1fe7cdffc62450f66377a4bcdf5ccbc2a280a7207c77bc990b95185

build:
  number: 4
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}                # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}          # [win]
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}        # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_fortran') }}  # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-ncdf4
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-ncdf4

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('HiClimR')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('HiClimR')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/hsbadr/HiClimR
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: "A tool for Hierarchical Climate Regionalization applicable to any correlation-based clustering. It adds several features and a new clustering method (called, 'regional' linkage) to hierarchical clustering in R ('hclust' function in 'stats' library): data regridding, coarsening spatial resolution, geographic masking,\
    \ contiguity-constrained clustering, data filtering by mean and/or variance thresholds, data preprocessing (detrending, standardization, and PCA), faster correlation function with preliminary big data support, different clustering methods, hybrid hierarchical clustering, multivariate clustering (MVC), cluster validation,\
    \ visualization of regionalization results, and exporting region map and mean timeseries into NetCDF-4 file."
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - PertuyF

# Package: HiClimR
# Version: 2.1.4
# Title: Hierarchical Climate Regionalization
# Author: Hamada S. Badr [aut, cre], Benjamin F. Zaitchik [aut], Amin K. Dezfuli [aut]
# Description: A tool for Hierarchical Climate Regionalization applicable to any correlation-based clustering. It adds several features and a new clustering method (called, 'regional' linkage) to hierarchical clustering in R ('hclust' function in 'stats' library): data regridding, coarsening spatial resolution, geographic masking, contiguity-constrained clustering, data filtering by mean and/or variance thresholds, data preprocessing (detrending, standardization, and PCA), faster correlation function with preliminary big data support, different clustering methods, hybrid hierarchical clustering, multivariate clustering (MVC), cluster validation, visualization of regionalization results, and exporting region map and mean timeseries into NetCDF-4 file.
# License: GPL (>= 2)
# URL: https://github.com/hsbadr/HiClimR
# BugReports: https://github.com/hsbadr/HiClimR/issues
# Maintainer: Hamada S. Badr <badr@jhu.edu>
# Depends: R (>= 2.10)
# Imports: graphics, grDevices, stats, utils, ncdf4
# Suggests: devtools, knitr, rmarkdown, roxygen2
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# Encoding: UTF-8
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.1
# LazyData: yes
# LazyLoad: yes
# ByteCompile: yes
# NeedsCompilation: yes
# SystemRequirements: NetCDF (>= 4.1)
# Packaged: 2019-01-20 20:11:51 UTC; hbadr1
# Repository: CRAN

It adds several features and a new clustering method (called, 'regional' linkage) to hierarchical clustering in R ('hclust' function in 'stats' library): data regridding, coarsening spatial resolution, geographic masking, contiguity-constrained clustering, data filtering by mean and/or variance thresholds, data preprocessing (detrending, standardization, and PCA), faster correlation function with preliminary big data support, different clustering methods, hybrid hierarchical clustering, multivariate clustering (MVC), cluster validation, visualization of regionalization results, and exporting region map and mean timeseries into NetCDF-4 file.
